intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium diaphanoides subsp. alfvengrenii, commonly known as the translucent hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and yellowish to brownish flowers. The subspecies alfvengrenii is distinguished by its finely divided, translucent leaves and reduced floral structures. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in many regions.
